refnamediv.refpurpose: draw an entity. This function is obsolete.

listitem.para: a handle, the handle on an entity to draw. h can be a vector of handles, in which case all objects identified by h(i) will be drawn.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This function can be used to draw entities specified by h even if its parent figure immediate_drawing property is "off". If no argument is specified, the current object is drawn. Note that the window must not be resized ; if not, those objects are hidden back.
WARNING: Obsolete function.from Scilab 5.4.0 and is going to be removed with Scilab 5.4.1.

refsection.title: Examples
refsection.para: Those two exemples below behave the same way hiding and showing objects.

para.programlisting:
subplot(212) a=gca(); plot2d drawlater
subplot(211) plot2d1 // default drawing mode
e=gce(); draw(e.children(2)) // draw a single polyline of the second axes
e.children(1).visible='off'; // We can choose to make a line invisible
draw(e) // draw Compound and its children <=> draw all the visible polylines
drawnow // ...now!
e.children(1).visible='on';
